medical_history.chief_complaint: Thoracic pain radiating to the scapula and weight loss in a 23-year-old male with history of recurrent respiratory papillomatosis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient initially diagnosed with recurrent respiratory papillomatosis at age 5 developed symptoms of weight loss and thoracic pain at age 22. Imaging revealed an enlarging mass in the right upper lobe, with a bronchial wash indicating invasive squamous cell carcinoma. The mass continued to enlarge and compressed the right main bronchus, leading to progressive respiratory compromise.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of recurrent respiratory papillomatosis diagnosed at age 5, requiring over 100 surgical interventions, multiple tracheotomies, and treatments including interferon-alpha. He experienced postobstructive pneumonia and pulmonary abscesses.
medical_history.social_history: The patient smoked approximately one half to one pack of cigarettes per day, totaling less than 10 pack-years.
